intro: Monogynella exaltata, commonly known as the tall sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a sprawling growth habit with branching stems and small, narrow leaves. Monogynella exaltata is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
